Letter Spacing

Letter spacing properties for manipulating the space between each character in text. Below are the listed css classes that come default with Eezo.

why so many? Well; I find letter-spacing is rarely used, and when it is, it's often just a magic number. So Eezo provides a scale based on fractions of the em size of the character that you can choose from. And if you have some special tracking size you'd like to use, it can easily be added to, or replace, the default scale.

class name letter-spacing value
.lsn normal
.ls5- -0.25em
.ls4- -0.125em
.ls3- -0.075em
.ls2- -0.05em
.ls1- -0.025em
.ls0 0
.ls1 0.025em
.ls2 0.05em
.ls3 0.075em
.ls4 0.125em
.ls5 0.25em
.ls6 0.5em
.ls7 1em
.ls8 1.5em
.ls9 2em
.ls10 3em

Usage example

<h2 class="upper ls3">
    Text is uppercase and slightly tracked.
<h2>

Media Queries

Letter spacings adhere to the media-query class style. (see the media query section for details)

<body class="ls1 tb-lsn dt-ls1-">
    Letter spacing is:
        - slightly increased on mobile
        - normal on tablet
        - slightly decreased on desktop
</body>

Customising

Default Classes

To change the default prefix from ls to something else, then use $letter-spacing-prop variable:

// change the class prefix to `.let-`:
$letter-spacing-prop: "let-";

Custom Spacings

Actually, you may have special or unique letter spacings for your website, or even none at all. Then you can modify the map below to your suiting.

// change the letter spacing map so there's,
// only a couple of custom values.
$letter-spacings: (
   n: none,
   c: 0.067em,
   a: 0.124em
);

Combined

The previous two customisations combined:

// would result in css like:
.let-n: { letter-spacing: none; }
.let-c: { letter-spacing: 0.067em; }
.let-a: { letter-spacing: 0.124em; }

view the source on github: /src/components/text/_letter-spacing.scss
